list_definition.definition: to cover by wrapping; to surround completely

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She enveloped herself in a long cloak.

list_ex_of_english: These curves are then assembled into a mesh that is enveloped by appropriate surface patches.
The sole common climatic trait of the area enveloped by these collection sites is annual rainfall over 1300 mm, devoid of any marked seasonality.
The journal vividly portrays the sense of uncertainty that enveloped the city as news of a^airs around its perimeters trickled in.
The subject is enveloped by an emptiness and is already within its panorama, although a modest one.
The dashed lines represent the permutation envelopes calculated based on 1000 permutations of the morphs among locations within each population (see text for details).
It is ultimately the dimension by virtue of which things appear as enveloping one another rather than being juxtaposed.
And the workspace of the cube-manipulator is, then, the intersection of the three enveloping solids.
Thus, for a court to have the potential of wielding real power, its jurisdiction must envelop salient political, social, and economic questions.
